item.title: By: Keir
item.dc:creator: Keir
item.description: Yes, yes, I'm not a details man.
item.content:encoded: Yes, yes, I’m not a details man.

item.title: By: brian
item.dc:creator: brian
item.description: I can’t let Keir’s comment pass as it stands. Yes, I do dabble in Deleuzian speculation as I watch the carcrash that is Leeds United. But I do so in a thoroughly engaged manner, so the actual text message was “Things only work by <i>fucking up</i>.” There’s a world of difference...
item.content:encoded: I can’t let Keir’s comment pass as it stands. Yes, I do dabble in Deleuzian speculation as I watch the carcrash that is Leeds United. But I do so in a thoroughly engaged manner, so the actual text message was “Things only work by fucking up.” There’s a world of difference…

item.title: By: Nate
item.dc:creator: Nate
item.description: I've got to mark a lot of territory, cuz I drink lots of tea and lots of beer, which means lots of ... umm ... marking ... stuff to ... mark with.
item.content:encoded: I’ve got to mark a lot of territory, cuz I drink lots of tea and lots of beer, which means lots of … umm … marking … stuff to … mark with.

item.title: By: Keir
item.dc:creator: Keir
item.description: Hey what's going on. How come you're blogging. Did Leeds' nadir make you think of the website, arf, arf. Seriously though folks, Me and Brian go and watch Leeds United (don't sit together) and he texts me Deleuzian anaylsis of the match. Last night it was: "Things only work by breaking down (sic)". Although the best was when we debated the concept of cramped space in reference to the Leeds midfield.<br/><br/>Still you are right, when we worked on re-writing ACM's I was struck by how well it sets up the direction we've been going since which has been more focused on movement dynamics. In reality I think it only seems contiguous in retrospect because we went in some very contigent and unpredicted directions in the meantime.
item.content:encoded:
Hey what’s going on. How come you’re blogging. Did Leeds’ nadir make you think of the website, arf, arf. Seriously though folks, Me and Brian go and watch Leeds United (don’t sit together) and he texts me Deleuzian anaylsis of the match. Last night it was: “Things only work by breaking down (sic)”. Although the best was when we debated the concept of cramped space in reference to the Leeds midfield.

Still you are right, when we worked on re-writing ACM’s I was struck by how well it sets up the direction we’ve been going since which has been more focused on movement dynamics. In reality I think it only seems contiguous in retrospect because we went in some very contigent and unpredicted directions in the meantime.
